senses.sense_definition: Capable of being offset against another amount or included in a net calculation, typically in financial or legal contexts.

examples.text: The accountant checked if the losses were <w>nettable</w> against the year's profits.
Under the new regulations, these two types of transactions are legally <w>nettable</w>.

senses.sense_definition: Capable of being caught or captured using a net.

examples.text: The wildlife expert identified which birds were <w>nettable</w> for tagging purposes.
Small fish in the shallow water are easily <w>nettable</w> with basic equipment.
